C1 A6lb 5/02 9 Karl F [50] Field ofSearch 128/105 ABSTRACT; A device for measuring fluid velocity of the R f ed blood stream utilizing frequency modulated ultrasound trans- [56] e erences n mitted through the moving blood with a composite signal de- UNITED STATES PATENTS tected, difference frequency signal extracted, phases across 2,826,912 3/1958 Kritz 73/194 each of a pair of transducers compared, and the difference in 2,911,826 11/1959 Kritz 73/ 194 phase being a measure of blood stream velocity.}
textBeforeTable: Patent Citations 6. The method of claim 5 further characterized by mounting said pair of transducers by clamping them to the blood vessel in diagonally opposite positions against opposite sides of the blood vessel. calibrating and indicating the phase difference in terms of velocity of the fluid flow in the blood vessel. detecting, mixing, and filtering the signal from each of said transducers and combining the signals from each of said transducers for phase comparison; and generating an electric signal by modulating a frequency modulated oscillator with a repetitive voltage ramp which is then fed to each of said transducers; mounting a pair of crystal transducers spaced apart upstream and downstream of the fluid flow and defining a transmission path for ultrasonic waves therebetween through said fluid, with the crystals of said transducers in contact with the wall of the blood vessel; surgically exposing a blood vessel; 5. A method of measuring the velocity of fluid flow in a blood vessel which comprises: 4. The ultrasonic apparatus of claim 1 wherein said transducers include crystals of lead zirconate-titanate. said longitudinal portions shaped and adapted for fitting around a blood vessel surgically exposed; and said transducers adapted to be positioned against and on opposite sides of the blood vessel. 3. The ultrasonic apparatus of claim 2 further characterized by: said first transducer mounted on one
